pinyin: bin1 yu3 guan1 xi4 cong2 ju4

sentences.english: Transitive verb must be followed by an object.
sentences.chinese: 及物動詞之後須帶賓語。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物動詞可接反身代詞作賓語。

sentences.english: The content of each element is the object.
sentences.chinese: 每個元素的內容是賓語。

sentences.english: "Run" is an intransitive verb. No object can be followed.
sentences.chinese: Run是不及物動詞，後面不能帶賓語。

sentences.english: The paper concluded that single-syllable adjectives may connect with object, especially in the Chinese prevailing in the early Qin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 筆者認爲先秦漢語單音節形容詞是可以帶賓語的。

sentences.english: Many verbs normally have an object. These verbs are called" transitive " verbs.
sentences.chinese: 許多動詞通常要跟賓語，被稱爲作及物動詞。

sentences.english: Reflexive pronouns can be direct or indirect object.
sentences.chinese: 反身代詞可作直接或間接賓語。

sentences.english: The double objects sentence is one kind of sentence types extremely rich in characteristics in the modern Chinese grammar system.
sentences.chinese: 雙賓語句是現代漢語語法體系中富有特色的一種句式。

sentences.english: Adverbials usually come after the verb, or after the object if there is one.
sentences.chinese: 狀語通常置於謂語動詞或賓語之後。

sentences.english: Most transitive verbs can take a reflexive pronoun as object.
sentences.chinese: 大部分及物動詞可跟反身代詞作賓語。

sentences.english: Li Ming put on his coat and went out .
sentences.chinese: “穿上”強調動作，賓語常接衣服，鞋帽等。

sentences.english: The dative markers are very different in Chinese dialects.
sentences.chinese: 雙賓語句中引進與事的介詞在漢語方言中頗有歧異。

sentences.english: Basic attributes like name and phone number will map to predicates with literal objects.
sentences.chinese: 姓名和電話這類基本屬性映射爲文字賓語謂詞。

sentences.english: In Chinese teaching, case grammar can be applied to teach non-patient objects.
sentences.chinese: 漢語教學中，格語法適用於非受事賓語。

sentences.english: Sometimess we use question words+to-infinitives to replace object clauses.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們用疑問詞十動詞不定式來代替賓語從句。

sentences.english: Intransitive verbs do not have an object.

definition: part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
